sudoku.gui

Class SudokuFieldFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • sudoku.gui.SudokuFieldFactory

  • public final class SudokuFieldFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    This class can be used to read a Sudoku from a given file.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private static class  SudokuFieldFactory.Line
      Combines a text line of the file with its line number.

      • invalidFileError

        private static void invalidFileError(int lineNumber)
                              throws java.text.ParseException
        Reports a parse error within the input file.
        Parameters:
        lineNumber - The line in the file which contains an error.
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - If the file is not using the expected format.

      • loadFromFile

        public static SudokuField loadFromFile(java.io.File file)
                                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                       java.io.IOException,
                                       java.text.ParseException
        Loads a Sudoku from a given file and creates the data representing it.
        Parameters:
        file - The input file.
        Returns:
        the Sudoku given by the file.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the input file could not be found.
        java.io.IOException - If an IO error occurs.
        java.text.ParseException - If the file is not using the expected format.

      • parseCellContent

        private static int parseCellContent(java.util.Scanner scanner,
                                    int maxNumber,
                                    int lineNumber)
                             throws java.text.ParseException
        Parses the content of a Sudoku cell within a row and returns either the number or SudokuBoard.UNSET_CELL if the entry is ".".
        Parameters:
        scanner - The scanner containing the row.
        maxNumber - The maximal number that may be inserted into a cell.
        lineNumber - The current line within the file.
        Returns:
        The content of the cell.
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - If the entry has not the expected format.

      • parseRow

        private static void parseRow(java.lang.String line,
                             DisplayedSudoku sudoku,
                             int currentRow,
                             int lineNumber)
                      throws java.text.ParseException
        Takes a String, tries to translate it into a Sudoku row and adds it to sudoku if possible as row currentRow.
        Parameters:
        line - The line representing a row of a SudokuBoard.
        sudoku - The Sudoku that the row should be added to.
        currentRow - The position of the row in the sudoku.
        lineNumber - The number of the line within the Reader.
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - If the file has not the expected format.

      • parseRowsPerBoxAndColumnsPerBox

        private static int[] parseRowsPerBoxAndColumnsPerBox(java.lang.String arg,
                                                     int lineNumber)
                                              throws java.text.ParseException
        Reads the number of rows and the number of columns of the sudoku from args and returns the two numbers within an array with the number of rows at position 0 and number of columns at position 1.
        Parameters:
        arg - The String containing the numbers.
        lineNumber - The current line.
        Returns:
        the number of rows and the number of columns of Sudoku.
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - If the file does not have the expected format.

      • readLine

        private static SudokuFieldFactory.Line readLine(java.io.BufferedReader reader,
                                                int lineNumber)
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a line from a BufferedReader, and returns it with its number within the file. Treats lines that start with '#' as commentaries. Returns null after the end of the file has been reached.
        Parameters:
        reader - The Reader containing the line(s) to be read.
        lineNumber - The number of the last read line.
        Returns:
        the next line of the reader that is no comment with its number.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O Error occurs.
